meaning: arrived (at); reached; come to; entered; become
example_1: vevaṇṇiy'amhi ajjhupagato'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ
ahaṃ sukhito homi niddukkho homi avero homi abyāpajjho homi anīgho homi sukhī attānaṃ pariharāmi
example_2: saṅkhāya lokasmi paroparāni, yass'iñjitaṃ n'atthi kuhiñci loke, santo vidhūmo anīgho nirāso, atāri so jātijaran'ti brūmī'ti.
example_3: abyāpannacitto hoti appaduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo ime sattā averā hontu abyāpajjā anīghā sukhī attānaṃ pariharantū'ti
example_4: mātaraṃ pitaraṃ hantvā, rājāno dve ca sotthiye, veyagghapañcamaṃ hantvā, anīgho yāti brāhmaṇo.

example_1: dūteyyapahiṇagamana-anuyogā paṭivirato hoti, kayavikkayā paṭivirato hoti, tulākūṭakaṃsakūṭamānakūṭā paṭivirato hoti
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā ātappam'anvāya padhānam'anvāya anuyogam'anvāya appamādam'anvāya sammāmanasikāram'anvāya tathārūpaṃ cetosamādhiṃ phusati yathāsamāhite citte anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarati
example_3: indriyesu guttadvārā bhavissāma, bhojane mattaññuno, jāgariyaṃ anuyuttā, vipassakā kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, pubbaratt'āpararattaṃ bodhipakkhiyānaṃ dhammānaṃ, bhāvanā-anuyogam'anuyuttā viharissāmā'ti.

example_1: tāvatiṃsānaṃ devānaṃ saddaṃ sutvā yāmā devā saddam'anussāvesuṃ
example_2: dīghassa parajanassa yakkhassa saddaṃ sutvā bhummā devā saddam'anussāvesuṃ, lābhā vata bho vajjīnaṃ

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā sikkhamānāya vā sāmaṇerassa vā sāmaṇeriyā vā sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ vikappetvā appaccuddhāraṇaṃ paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning: perfectly; absolutely; (comm) having gone deeply with wisdom
example_1: yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo, tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati, idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ, etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
example_2: dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti

meaning: perfect clarity; absolute faith; epithet of stream entry
example_1: dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti

meaning: (expressing contempt) oh aren't you a!; you're a fine example of!
example_1: aho vata re amhākaṃ paṇḍitakā, aho vata re amhākaṃ bahussutakā, aho vata re amhākaṃ tevijjakā

meaning: (expressing pleasure, surprise or disbelief) oh!; wow!
example_1: rājā satthu vacanaṃ sutvā, aho, bhante, bhāriyaṃ kammaṃ, ettake nāma bhoge vijjamāne n'eva attanā paribhuñji, na tumhādise buddhe dhuravihāre viharante puññakammaṃ akāsī'ti āha.
example_2: aho vata re amhākaṃ paṇḍitaka, aho vata re amhākaṃ bahussutaka, aho vata re amhākaṃ tevijjaka
example_3: maraṇadhammānaṃ sattānaṃ evaṃ icchā uppajjati aho vata mayaṃ na maraṇadhammā assāma, na ca vata no maraṇaṃ āgaccheyyā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ icchāya pattabbaṃ, idam'pi yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ

meaning: material heir; inheritor of worldly things
example_1: tassa me tumhe puttā orasā mukhato jātā dhammajā dhammanimmitā dhammadāy'ādā, no āmisadāy'ādā.
example_2: bhagavā etadavoca, dhammadāy'ādā me, bhikkhave, bhavatha, mā āmisadāy'ādā
example_3: tumhe'pi tena ādissā bhaveyyātha, āmisadāy'ādā satthusāvakā viharanti, no dhammadāy'ādā'ti

example_1: tato pāsādikaṃ āsi, gataṃ bhuttaṃ nisevitaṃ. siniddhā teladhārā'va, ahosi iriyāpatho.

meaning: posture; pose; deportment; (specifically) walking, standing, sitting, and lying down
example_1: tato pāsādikaṃ āsi, gataṃ bhuttaṃ nisevitaṃ. siniddhā teladhārā'va, ahosi iriyāpatho.
example_2: evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, puriso oḷārikaṃ oḷārikaṃ iriyāpathaṃ abhinivajjetvā sukhumaṃ sukhumaṃ iriyāpathaṃ kappeyya.
example_3: atha kho uttarassa māṇavassa etadahosi, samannāgato kho samaṇo gotamo dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇehi. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ anubandheyyaṃ, iriyāpatham'assa passeyyan'ti.

yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti
example_2: dujjīvitaṃ nāma hatthacchinnassa pādacchinnassa hatthapādacchinnassa kaṇṇacchinnassa nāsacchinnassa kaṇṇanāsacchinnassa, iminā ca pāpakena iminā ca dujjīvitena mataṃ te jīvitā seyyo'ti.

meaning: easy on the ear; pleasant to hear
example_1: yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
atha kho pesso ca hatth'ārohaputto kandarako ca paribbājako yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā pesso hatth'ārohaputto bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.
tathārūpānaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena vūpakaṭṭho viharati, kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.
example_2: so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena sampādeti, kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.

meaning: name of Mahāmoggallāna's sister in a previous incarnation
example_1: bhūtapubbāhaṃ, pāpima, dūsī nāma māro ahosiṃ, tassa me kāḷī nāma bhaginī. tassā tvaṃ putto. so me tvaṃ bhāgineyyo ahosi. tena kho pana, pāpima, samayena kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno hoti.

meaning: name of the royal capital of king Mahāsudassana
example_1: bhūtapubb'āhaṃ, bhikkhu, rājā ahosiṃ khattiyo muddh'āvasitto. tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītinagarasahassāni ahesuṃ kusāvatī rājadhānippamukhāni.
example_2: tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā nagarasahassānaṃ ekaññ'eva taṃ nagaraṃ hoti yam'ahaṃ tena samayena ajjhāvasāmi, kusāvatī rājadhānī.
example_3: kusāvatiyā, ānanda, rājadhāniyā catunnaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ dvārāni ahesuṃ. ekaṃ dvāraṃ sovaṇṇamayaṃ, ekaṃ rūpiyamayaṃ, ekaṃ veḷuriyamayaṃ, ekaṃ phalikamayaṃ.

example_1: asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī, gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī'ti
example_2: tato pāsādikaṃ āsi, gataṃ bhuttaṃ nisevitaṃ. siniddhā teladhārā'va, ahosi iriyāpatho.

example_1: cātummahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ saddaṃ sutvā tāvatiṃsā devā saddam'anussāvesuṃ
tathārūpānaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena vūpakaṭṭho viharati, kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.
ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, jāgariyaṃ anuyutto viharāhi, divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhehi
example_2: niddaṃ na bahulīkareyya, jāgariyaṃ bhajeyya ātāpī, tandiṃ māyaṃ hassaṃ khiḍḍaṃ, methunaṃ vippajahe savibhūsaṃ.

meaning: birth and old age; being born and ageing
example_1: so karohi dīpam'attano, khippaṃ vāyama paṇḍito bhava, niddhantamalo anaṅgaṇo, na punaṃ jātijaraṃ upehisi.
example_2: saṅkhāya lokasmiṃ paroparāni, yass'iñjitaṃ n'atthi kuhiñci loke, santo vidhūmo anīgho nirāso, atāri so jātijaran'ti brūmī'ti.
example_3: kathañ'ca bhikkhu brāhmaṇo hoti? bāhit'āssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, saṃkilesikā, ponobbhavikā, sadarā, dukkhavipākā, āyatiṃ, jātijarāmaraṇiyā.

meaning: leading to birth old age and death
example_1: bāhit'āssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā saṃkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkhavipākā āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇiyā
varo varaññū varado var'āharo, anuttaro dhammavaraṃ adesayi, idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ, etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
example_2: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā te sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti tesañ'ca sotabbaṃ maññissanti

meaning: belonging to the (Heaven of the) Thirty Three
example_1: cātummahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ saddaṃ sutvā tāvatiṃsā devā saddam'anussāvesuṃ
example_2: yadā, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ pātubhavati, na tassaṃ parisāyaṃ koci devo abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti.
example_3: tena sudaṃ, bhante, devatā tāvatiṃsā attamanā honti pamuditā pītisomanassajātā dibbā vata bho kāyā paripūrenti, hāyanti asurakāyā'ti
example_4: sakko ce me varaṃ dajjā, tāvatiṃsānam'issaro, t'āhaṃ bhadde vareyy'āhe, evaṃ kāmo daḷho mama.

example_1: tato pāsādikaṃ āsi, gataṃ bhuttaṃ nisevitaṃ. siniddhā teladhārā'va, ahosi iriyāpatho.
example_2: seyyathā'pi nāma gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā nānābhesajjāni seyyath'idaṃ sappi navanītaṃ telaṃ madhu phāṇitaṃ
example_3: tatra y'āssa sakkharā vā kaṭhalā vā sā adhogāmī assa, yañ'ca khv'assa tatra sappi vā telaṃ vā taṃ uddhaṃ gāmi assa.
example_4: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti.

example_1: tato pāsādikaṃ āsi, gataṃ bhuttaṃ nisevitaṃ. siniddhā teladhārā'va, ahosi iriyāpatho.

meaning: resulting in suffering; with painful results
example_1: samit'āssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā saṃkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkhavipākā āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇiyā
example_2: yaṃ kho ahaṃ idaṃ kāyena kammaṃ kattukāmo idaṃ me kāyakammaṃ attabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, parabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, ubhayabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, akusalaṃ idaṃ kāyakammaṃ dukkh'udrayaṃ dukkhavipākan'ti
example_3: bhikkhunā tesaṃ vitakkānaṃ ādīnavo upaparikkhitabbo, iti'p'ime vitakkā akusalā, iti'p'ime vitakkā sāvajjā, iti'p'ime vitakkā dukkhavipākā'ti.

meaning: name of a Māra; previous incarnation of Mahāmoggallāna
example_1: bhūtapubbāhaṃ, pāpima, dūsī nāma māro ahosiṃ, tassa me kāḷī nāma bhaginī. tassā tvaṃ putto. so me tvaṃ bhāgineyyo ahosi. tena kho pana, pāpima, samayena kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno hoti.
dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena
example_2: methunadhammo nāma yo so asaddhammo gāmadhammo vasaladhammo duṭṭhullaṃ odak'antikaṃ rahassaṃ dvayaṃdvayasamāpatti, eso methunadhammo nāma.

meaning: born from Dhamma; born of the teaching
example_1: tassa me tumhe puttā orasā mukhato jātā dhammajā dhammanimmitā dhammadāy'ādā, no āmisadāy'ādā.

meaning: spiritual heir; inheritor of the Dhamma
example_1: tumhe ca me bhikkhave āmisadāy'ādā bhaveyyātha no dhammadāy'ādā, tumhe'pi tena ādiyā bhaveyyātha, āmisadāy'ādā satthusāvakā viharanti, no dhammadāy'ādā'ti
example_2: tassa me tumhe puttā orasā mukhato jātā dhammajā dhammanimmitā dhammadāy'ādā, no āmisadāy'ādā.

meaning: created by the Dhamma; fashioned from the Dhamma
example_1: tassa me tumhe puttā orasā mukhato jātā dhammajā dhammanimmitā dhammadāy'ādā, no āmisadāy'ādā.
so bajjhataṃ pāsasatehi chabbhi, rammā vanā niyyatu rājadhāniṃ, tuttehi so haññatu pācanehi, bhisāni te brāhmaṇa yo ahāsi.
example_2: kusāvatiyā, ānanda, rājadhāniyā catunnaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ dvārāni ahesuṃ. ekaṃ dvāraṃ sovaṇṇamayaṃ, ekaṃ rūpiyamayaṃ, ekaṃ veḷuriyamayaṃ, ekaṃ phalikamayaṃ.
example_3: asītivassasahass'āyukesu, bhikkhave, manussesu ayaṃ jambudīpo iddho c'eva bhavissati phīto ca, kukkuṭasampātikā gāmanigamarājadhāniyo.

example_1: yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti.

meaning: associated with; connected to; siding with
example_1: handa mayaṃ bodhipakkhiyadhammapāṭhaṃ bhaṇāmase

example_2: antamaso kus'aggena'pi anādiyitvā tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ navaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
example_3: aladdhā ca cīvaraṃ na ca paritassissāma, laddhā ca cīvaraṃ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhāpannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjissāma.

example_1: anavaṭṭhitacittassa, saddhammaṃ avijānato, pariplavapasādassa, paññā na paripūrati.

example_3: dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti
example_4: evam'eva kho cetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko, yato yato imassa dhammapariyāyassa paññāya atthaṃ upaparikkheyya, labheth'eva attamanataṃ, labheth'eva cetaso pasādaṃ.

meaning: evil one; evil personified; epithet of Māra
example_1: evaṃ vutte, ahaṃ, bhikkhave, māraṃ pāpimantaṃ etadavocaṃ, jānāmi kho t'āhaṃ, pāpima, mā tvaṃ maññittho, na maṃ jānātī'ti. māro tvam'asi, pāpima.
example_2: apuññaṃ pasavī māro, āsajja naṃ tathāgataṃ, kin'nu maññasi pāpima, na me pāpaṃ vipaccati.
example_3: bhūtapubbāhaṃ, pāpima, dūsī nāma māro ahosiṃ, tassa me kāḷī nāma bhaginī. tassā tvaṃ putto. so me tvaṃ bhāgineyyo ahosi.
example_4: upādiyamāno kho, bhikkhu, baddho mārassa, anupādiyamāno mutto pāpimato'ti. aññātaṃ bhagavā, aññātaṃ sugatā'ti.

example_1: tato pāsādikaṃ āsi, gataṃ bhuttaṃ nisevitaṃ. siniddhā teladhārā'va, ahosi iriyāpatho.

example_3: atha kho bhagavato etadahosi, pāsādikaṃ kho ayaṃ kulaputto iriyati. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ puccheyyan'ti.

meaning: conducive to repeated becoming; leading to renewed existence; leading to rebirth
example_1: yāyaṃ taṇhā ponobbhavikā nandirāgasahagatā tatratatr'ābhinandinī seyyath'īdaṃ kāmataṇhā bhavataṇhā vibhavataṇhā
example_2: tathāgatassa, pāpima, ye āsavā saṃkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkhavipākā āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇiyā, te pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.

example_1: yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
yo ve kiñcikkhakamyatā, panthasmiṃ vajantaṃ janaṃ, hantvā kiñcikkham'ādeti, taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.
example_2: mātaraṃ pitaraṃ hantvā, rājāno dve ca sotthiye, veyagghapañcamaṃ hantvā, anīgho yāti brāhmaṇo.

meaning: earlier part of the night; first third of the night; 6pm to 10pm
example_1: indriyesu guttadvārā bhavissāma, bhojane mattaññuno, jāgariyaṃ anuyuttā, vipassakā kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, pubbaratta-apararattaṃ bodhipakkhiyānaṃ dhammānaṃ, bhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharissāmā'ti.

meaning: later part of the night; last third of the night; 2am to 6am
example_1: indriyesu guttadvārā bhavissāma, bhojane mattaññuno, jāgariyaṃ anuyuttā, vipassakā kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, pubbaratta-apararattaṃ bodhipakkhiyānaṃ dhammānaṃ, bhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharissāmā'ti.
tato pāsādikaṃ āsi, gataṃ bhuttaṃ nisevitaṃ, siniddhā teladhārā'va, ahosi iriyāpatho.
